meanings.definition: The act of erasing or removing something by rubbing it out.
meanings.sent1: She used a rubber to do a rubout of the mistake on her paper.
meanings.sent2: The rubout of the pencil marks left the paper clean and neat.
meanings.sent3: During the exam, his rubout of the wrong answer made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The rubout of the graffiti on the wall revealed a beautiful mural underneath.
meanings.sent5: The rubout of the old logo made space for the new design to shine.

meanings.definition: A violent or sudden killing, especially by shooting.
meanings.sent1: The detective was called to investigate a rubout in the alley.
meanings.sent2: The mob boss ordered a rubout of his rival to take control of the territory.
meanings.sent3: The movie's exaggerated rubout scene had the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The rubout of the character in the novel shocked the readers with its unexpectedness.
meanings.sent5: The rubout of the villain in the final showdown brought justice to the town.
